title: How do I upgrade to windows 11 pro when the app store keeps failing and I did not receive a key in an email?
description: How do I upgrade to windows 11 pro when the app store keeps failing and I did not receive a key in an email? I purchased 11 pro through the app store. I've reached my limit for phone call and the tech support was helpful but did accomplish much

answers.content:
Hi, good day!
Please try the method below to trigger the edition change with a generic key:
Temporarily disconnect from the Internet
Press Windows key+I to open Settings
Select System > Activation > Change product key > Change
Enter the generic product key below:
VK7JG-NPHTM-C97JM-9MPGT-3V66T
When prompted, Click Activate Product
Make sure to sign in to the Microsoft account you used to purchase the Pro upgrade.
I look forward to receiving your update and I'm willing to collaborate with you till we resolve the issue. Do keep me informed.

It didn't work for me. I tried this yesterday, microsoft tried this yesterday and Wednesday. My company tech support tried this before I saw your response. Thank you. I changed my drives last year and that could be the issue or there is a bug in the app store. Others have this issue so its probably the app store. After 3 days of this I might run Ubuntu for a while and later buy a Mac. Fresh install of windows going on.  I hope that the restore of my data works. Wish me luck.
comments: It failed. I'm still at windows home. Purchasing full version of Pro. Getting refunds for two upgrades. Should have gotten the full version originally.

answers.content:
When you said fresh install did you perform a Reset this PC or Clean Install of Windows via USB flash drive?
If the issue persists, you may need to perform a Clean Install of Windows 11 Pro.
Download the Media Creation tool (Click Download tool now). Use the tool to "Create installation media (USB flash drive at least 8GB in size) to install Windows 11". Instructions inside the link.
Note: Please make sure to uncheck the "Use the recommended options for this PC" box. Please check the link below for more details.
https://support.microsoft.com/windows/create-installation-media-for-windows-99a58364-8c02-206f-aa6f-40c3b507420d
Insert the USB Installation media into your computer. Please change the boot order in the Bios Settings. Boot your PC from the Installation Media you created.
Kindly refer to the link below on How to Perform a Clean Install for more details.
https://support.microsoft.com/windows/reinstall-windows-with-the-installation-media-d8369486-3e33-7d9c-dccc-859e2b022fc7
I look forward to receiving your update and I'm willing to collaborate with you till we resolve the issue. Do keep me informed.
comments: Thanks for your answer. I requested refunds for the two upgrades that I purchased. The first was associated with an old email address. I bought the full version from best buy. I needed to use the included key after the new version of home was installed. Then the update to Pro happened. 9I know that I lost some files however Pro is installed and recover brought back a lot. This took why too long. Thanks for trying to help.

title: How to fix black screen in windows 11
description: Hello Windows Support, today i faced a problem when i was installing visual c++ from 2010 to 2022 that my game demanded and i downloaded from the official site of microsoft. After the installation, it demanded me to restart my pc (a button appeared directly from the installer). I pressed it and when it was about to restart, i faced a black screen with a note "your pc ran into a problem, we will restart it for you" with the error code unmountable_boot_volume.. i waited for an entire hour, nothing happened. I wish you could help me fixing this without a usb diagnostic.. If there isn't, tell me about the process of the usb. Note that i already tried forcing shutdowns for 2 times to make the diagnostic screen show up but nothing still.

title: Windows 10 showing me Weather, News and other widgets on my Lock screen when I have that disabled
description: Windows 10 is showing me a bunch of stuff I do not want on my lock screen. The widgets are Weather, Daily wonder, Quiz and events near me. I really do not want these there as I like my screens clear of clutter and I've spent so long trying to get rid of all the other news sources forced on me. I have disabled everything in Personalization - Lock screen. The Get fun facts,Tips and more is disabled. all the Detailed and Quick status is set to none but they still show. How do I get rid of these widgets

answers.content:
Hi ,  
The background is in Windows spotlight, if you have it, you would have to change it to a photo and you will stop receiving notifications in the lock screen settings.
Give feedback if the information was useful or not.  
Thanks
comments:
Thanks, this suggestion worked. I had to switch from my Picture set for my lock screen to the 'Windows Spotlight' - from there I saw a widget/app set to appear, set it to 'none' and then switched back to 'Picture' from the dropdown. This resolved it!

Hi ,  
I'm glad it worked out, you can always count on the Microsoft Q&A community, have a good week.  
Give feedback if the information was useful or not.  
Thanks

title: storage space
description:
is this enough storage and how do i fr
ee up more

answers.content:
Hi, 
It really depends on what you are using the storage for.
For basic stuff like file backups, a handful of documents, and some emails. That should be fine for now.
But if you are storing a bunch of photos, videos, or those large attachments, you will run out of space pretty quick.
You are already at 72%, so yeah, it is a good idea to clean things up or add more storage soon.

title: Win11 Updates on my PC get Hung Up
description:
For the past year or so, whenever I install an update to Win 11, the restart process seems to get hung up.  I know it takes some time to install, but after 30 minutes there doesn't appear to be any progress and, despite my laptop's fan running at high speed, the air coming out is very warm.  I shut down the laptop by holding the power button down and after about 5 minutes, restart my laptop.  Sometimes, I have to do this several times before it reboots.
I've tried using the troubleshooters, but haven't determined a cause.  It is time to take my laptop in for repair (e.g. reinstallation of Win 11)?

answers.content:
1
Click your Start Button, type winver and hit Enter
Please provide a screenshot of the resulting dialog.
2
Open the Settings App
Go to Windows Updates
Please provide a screenshot of that window
comments: I wonder if the problem has to do with HP Wolf Security.

title: rotation lock greyed out
description: Can't click on the rotation lock on my windows pc because it was greyed out

answers.content:
Hi, thank you for reaching out to the Microsoft Q&A forum. Iâm happy to help.
In the rotation settings, aside from being greyed out, do you also see any error message like 'Managed by your organization'?
Is this your personal computer? When did the issue start, and what changes were made?
comments:
No, no error message.  
Yes, it's my personal computer, and the issue has been ongoing for a while now. Thought it would go someday, but it didn't.

Thank you for your reply. Please try the following:
1: Reset Settings via PowerShell (Admin)
Right-click the Start Menu and choose Windows PowerShell (Admin).
Copy and paste the command below, then hit Enter:
Get-AppxPackage windows.immersivecontrolpanel | Reset-AppxPackage
Restart your computer then check.
2: Run SFC and DISM to check and repair system corrupted files:
Open Command Prompt as an administrator.
Copy and paste each command below, then press Enter. Please run each command one at a time:
sfc /scannow
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
Restart your PC
3. If that fails, the next step is to try System Recovery without deleting your files and apps.
Click the Start menu > Settings > System > Recovery.
Choose Reinstall Now under the section labeled 'Fix problems using Windows Update.'
Once completed, your system will restart. Please check afterward.

Issue still persist   
Still greyed out

I'm sorry to hear that. When did the issue start? Can you take a screenshot of the page where it is greyed out? Please make sure not to include any personal information.





Thanks for the screenshot. Were you able to use screen rotation before? Could you also provide the exact make and model of your device?

Yes, I could use the rotation lock before. HP EliteBook x360 1030 G2

Thank you for your reply. I noticed that the HP EliteBook x360 1030 G2 seems to be incompatible with Windows 11. Can you confirm if you are using Windows 10 or Windows 11?
The rotation issue may also be related to a graphics driver problem. In the meantime, please try the following:

 Press Windows + X, select Device Manager, and expand Display adapters. 

Right-click your display driver, select Uninstall Device.
Check Delete driver software for this device, then proceed with the uninstallation.
Restart your PC, and Windows will reinstall the drivers automatically.
Check if the issue is resolved.

 Download and install the graphics driver from the HP support website, then restart your computer and check if the issue is resolved:

https://support.hp.com/gb-en/drivers/hp-elitebook-x360-1030-g2-notebook-pc/model/14169376
Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

Windows 11 and it still didn't work.

Thank you for your reply. Which version of Windows are you on? For example, 22H2, 23H2, or 24H2. Go to Settings > System > Windows Update and apply all updates.
You can also try the suggestions from the HP website for this model: https://h30434.www3.hp.com/t5/Notebook-Video-Display-and-Touch/rotation-lock-is-grayed-out-Disabled/td-p/7714663
Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

Version 22H2

Thanks a lot.  
Finally fixed it.

title: Device manager does not work to uninstall a PS/2 keyboard
description:
I want to uninstall the keyboard on my Dell laptop because I want to use a wireless keyboard.
When I use device manager, keyboards, standard ps/2 keyboard, Uninstall, reboot: the Dell keyboard still works.
How do I turn off the Dell laptop keyboard?

answers.content:
Hello, James Margolis.
In order to disable any device in the Device Manager, you need to disable it, not delete it. The deletion causes the P&P function to be triggered when the PC is rebooted and finds a "new device" (previously deleted), installs the drivers and activates the device. And when disconnected, the system "sees" the device, but "knows" that it is disabled and should not be activated.

Hi Alexandr S,
Thank you for your prompt response which does not solve the problem.
Device manager does not have any options to "disable" or "delete" a keyboard. The only option is "uninstall". And uninstall does not uninstall, or delete, or disable the keyboard. See enclosed jpg file.
Microsoft-2025-09-12-device manager does not work.jpg
How does one "disable" the keyboard as you suggest?
And why are you mentioning the plug and play function? I am not trying to disable a plug and play device. I am trying to disable the keyboard that is installed in the Dell laptop.
Thanks,
James

title: Issues During Windows 11 Reinstallation on Asus Tuf A15
description:
Experiencing difficulties reinstalling Windows 11 on an Asus Tuf A15 due to a BSOD error "unmountable boot volume." After downloading Windows 11 using the Media Creation Tool and preparing a bootable pen drive, the installation process starts but often crashes, restarts automatically, or freezes during the initial phase where Windows files are copied. If there are no BSOD errors or freezes, it ends up in a restart loop shortly after beginning the file copying. 
Attempts to resolve this issue have not been successful, and assistance is urgently needed. My asus model is FA566NC.

answers.content:
Hi, 
Okay, so first thing, you gotta check those BIOS settings if things are acting up. Just restart your computer and hit F2 or DEL right away to get into the BIOS menu. That's for the ASUS TUF, you know, the usual way in.
Now, once you're in there. Load up the optimized defaults to reset everything. Pretty much wipes the slate clean.
Then, look for SATA Mode. Set that to AHCI, not RAID or anything else. Makes a big difference sometimes.
Fast Boot, disable it. Yeah, turn that off so it doesn't skip stuff.
Secure Boot, go ahead and disable it for now. Just temporarily, to test things out.
CSM, that's the Compatibility Support Module. Enable that one. Helps with older boot stuff.
Keep UEFI Boot Mode enabled, no changes there.
TPM can stay on if you're running Windows 11, but flip it off for testing purposes. See if that fixes whatever.
Alright, save those changes and exit. Restart and see how it goes.

title: having issues with my Audio and Video.
description: having issues with my Audio and Video. I recently purchased the Microsoft surface laptop 7 and the audio and video are out of sync on all streaming platforms as well as online like youtube netflix etc . I have tried updating my drivers . Deleting and reinstalling them. Clearing my cache data on web browser as well. Please provide me with assistanceâ¦ iâve basically done everything iâve seen on the internet

answers.content:
Hi James,
This is April, I'll be happy to assist you. Sorry to hear that you're having issue with Windows 11 Audio and Video. Let me help you out. 
Based on the description you provided, you recently purchased Microsoft Surface laptop 7 and the audio and video are out of sync on all streaming platforms. Since you have already covered the common troubleshooting steps (like updating drivers, clearing browser cache and reinstalling), let's move on to some deeper system-level fixes. These have worked for other Surface laptop 7 users experiencing the same sync issues.

 Disable Audio Enhancements   Audio Enhancements, especially on devices with Qualcomm audio chips, are a known cause of sync problems.

 Right-click the speaker icon in the taskbar > Sound settings
 Under Output, select your default device > Device properties > Additional device properties
 Go to the Enhancements tab and check Disable all enhancements
 Click Apply and restart your system


 Change the Audio Format   The default audio format can sometimes introduce latency.

 Follow the same steps above, but go to the Advance tab
 Try changing the default format to 16 bit, 44100 Hz (CD Quality) or 24 bit, 48000 Hz
 Test playback after each change to see if sync improves


 Disable Hardware Acceleration in Your Browser   Browsers like Chrome and Edge use GPU acceleration, which can cause audio/video desync.

 In Chrome: Settings > System > Toggle off Use hardware acceleration when available
 Restart the browser after making the change


 Install the Latest Firmware Updates   Even with updated drivers, outdated firmware can cause persistent sync issues.

 Visit the official Microsoft Surface Laptop 7 download page https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/2297733/new-surface-laptop-7-audio-video-sync
 Manually download and install the latest firmware and driver package for your model


 Test with Local Playback   Try playing a downloaded video using the built-in Movies & TV app instead of streaming.

 If sync issues occur even with local files, it's likely a deeper system-level audio processing issue - not just browser-related.



If the issue continues, please donât hesitate to contact us again. Weâre here to help, and we appreciate your continued trust in us.
Warm Regards,
April P.
Independent Advisor
comments:
Hi April thanks for response '
Ive tried all of the above and nothing has worked

title: Need Help: Random BSODs with ntoskrnl.exe and NETIO.SYS Errors - High-End System
description:
Need Help: Random BSODs with ntoskrnl.exe and NETIO.SYS Errors - High-End System
System Specifications

 CPU: Intel i9-13900K
 Motherboard: ASUS ROG MAXIMUS Z690 FORMULA
 GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3090 Ti
 RAM: 4x ADATA AX5U6400C4016G-DCCARGY (total 64GB)
 Storage: 2x M.2 SSDs (1 for OS, 1 for games)
 PSU: Corsair HX1200
 BIOS: Latest version 4301 (released 2025/05/26)

Problem Description
I'm experiencing random Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) crashes on my high-end gaming system. The crashes seem to occur randomly during general use. It happens since I bought my PC in 2022 and I already changed every HW component except the MoBo. Asus EMEA support team that I contacted more than once during those years always refused to change it. During those years the problem seemd to diasappear but in reality some time happened when PC was in idle and I was far from PC for some other reason and didn't provoke frustration. Yesterday started to trigger itself continuosly making PC experience impossible.
Error Information
The crashes are associated with these memory addresses:

 ntoskrnl.exe+4fec10
 NETIO.SYS+1c688
 NETIO.SYS+23ca8
 ntoskrnl.exe+4f9280

Troubleshooting Steps Already Taken
Driver Updates

 All drivers and BIOS are completely up to date
 Using Intel Driver & Support Assistant for automatic updates
 Following comprehensive driver update guide from ASUS MoBo Driver thread on elevenforum.com
 Manually verified and updated all system drivers

Advanced Troubleshooting

 Driver Verifier: Attempted to use Windows Driver Verifier to identify problematic drivers

 Result: System became stuck in restart loop and eventually froze completely
 Had to restore from previous system image to recover
 This suggests a potential driver compatibility issue



What I'm Looking For

 Suggestions for identifying which specific driver or hardware component might be causing the crashes
 Alternative methods to Driver Verifier for troubleshooting driver issues
 Experience with similar error addresses on Z690 chipset systems
 Recommendations for memory testing or other hardware diagnostics
 Any known issues with this hardware combination

Additional Information

 System is relatively new but crashes have been occurring intermittently
 No obvious pattern to when crashes occur (not tied to specific applications)
 System runs stable most of the time, crashes are sporadic
 All components are running at stock speeds (no overclocking)
 RAM QVL 

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Has anyone experienced similar issues with this hardware combination or these specific error addresses?

title: SFC, DISM Windows file repairs
description:
Frequently, in an effort to solve numerous non-specific problems, questioners are asked to run SFC and DISM.  While I understand WHAT these tools do, I'm not sure HOW Windows system and other files become corrupted and need to be "fixed."  Digital copies are SUPPOSED to be exact and disk files are NOT SUPPOSED to be over-written.  Guess you have some splainin' to do.
Thanks.
